page.title: 09WATER
page.content:
My name is Colin Yapp. The river Severn runs near to my home. It runs from the top to the bottom of Wales. It starts on Plynlimon on the Dyfed Powys border in Clwyd and flows down to Bristol and supplies our fresh water from the Welsh mountains.
The fish that swim in the Severn are salmon, trout and roach.
In the winter the river gets very frozen and in autumn it floods very badly near Forden. To help the flooding the nearest dam is Clewedog Dam which controls our drinking water.
The river Severn is the biggest river in the country and is probably one of the biggest in Europe.
